sentences: Bryan James Sledge (born November 23, 1984), better known by his stage name BJ the Chicago Kid (or simply BJ), is an American singer and songwriter from Chicago, Illinois.
Sledge is best known for frequently collaborating with Top Dawg Entertainment recording artists Schoolboy Q, Ab-Soul, Kendrick Lamar, and Jay Rock.
He has also worked with several other prominent rappers, such as Freddie Gibbs, Warren G, Nekfeu, Big K.R.I.T., GLC, Kanye West and Anderson .
Paak, among numerous others.
Sledge's first work in the music industry was on a Dave Hollister record in 2001, titled "For You", which he co-wrote alongside Gerald Haddon.

Sledge's vocals were first featured on a high-profile single in 2006; a song by Chicago rapper Kanye West titled "Impossible" was released in promotion for the 2006 American film Mission: Impossible III.
In February 2012, he independently released his debut studio album, Pineapple Now-Laters.
Sledge subsequently secured a record deal with Motown, in August 2012.
The label then serviced the Pineapple Now-Laters song "Good Luv'n", as Sledge's commercial debut single.
Life and career ==

sentences: Bryan Sledge was born to church choir directors in Chicago, Illinois.
section: == Life and career == | === 1984–2008: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He grew up in the Brainerd neighborhood on Chicago's South Side.
section: == Life and career == | === 1984–2008: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Sledge became inspired to pursue a music career after seeing Janet Jackson perform on tour.
section: == Life and career == | === 1984–2008: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: At the age of 19, he moved to Los Angeles, California, where he became a backup singer for American gospel duo Mary Mary.
section: == Life and career == | === 1984–2008: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He also performed on Stevie Wonder's A Time to Love (2005).
section: == Life and career == | === 1984–2008: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He later wrote for R&B and gospel artists such as Crystal Aikin, Shirley Caesar, Lalah Hathaway, Joe and Kindred the Family Soul.
section: == Life and career == | === 1984–2008: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Later, he performed on Kanye West's single "Impossible," which also features Twista and Keyshia Cole.
section: == Life and career == | === 1984–2008: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Mixtapes ===
In 2009, Sledge released his debut mixtape, A Taste of Chicago, under the moniker BJ the Chicago Kid.
Later that year, he followed up with The New Beginning.
In 2011, he released his third mixtape, titled The Life of Love's Cupid.
=== 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal =
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===
== Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: In February 2012, Sledge independently released his debut studio album, titled Pineapple Now-Laters, under M.A.F. E MUSIC LLC.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: In August 2012, it was announced that Sledge signed a recording contract with American record company, Motown.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: After inking his new deal with the label, Motown Label Services began promoting the Pineapple Now-Laters track "Good Luv'n," at Urban and Rhythmic radio formats in North America and released it as a single via digital distribution.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: In February 2013, Sledge released the track titled "Honey."
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: Sledge's collaboration with American rappers Freddie Gibbs and Problem, titled "Smokin' and Ridin'", is featured on Radio Los Santos in Grand Theft Auto V, the fifth installment in the critically acclaimed video game series.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: In October 2013, Sledge revealed he began working on his major label debut, which was then announced to be released sometime in 2014.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: Later that year, in December 2013, Sledge released a Christmas-themed extended play (EP), titled A Soulful Christmas, for free online.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: On April 22, 2014, West Coast rapper Schoolboy Q released "Studio", which features vocals from Sledge, as the fourth single from his album Oxymoron.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: "Studio" acquired Sledge Billboard chart placement and went on to chart in the Top 40 of the US Billboard Hot 100.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: On November 19, 2014, Sledge released his fourth mixtape, The M.A.F.E. Project.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: The mixtape features 12 songs and guest appearances from Freddie Gibbs, Sasha Go Hard, Schoolboy Q and Smoke DZA.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: On December 23, 2014, Motown Records released a song from The M.A.F.E. Project titled "It's True", which features a verse from Schoolboy Q, as a single.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: The single was accompanied by a music video directed by Verluxe.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: On February 19, 2016, Sledge released his major label debut album, "In My Mind".
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–present: In My Mind and Motown record deal ===

sentences: Sledge released his third studio album, 1123, on July 26, 2019.
